title: PS3 Game Collecting :: Tips & Advice :: Part 1

media:group.media:title: PS3 Game Collecting :: Tips & Advice :: Part 1
media:group.media:description:
Welcome to the start of my PS3 coverage: What I have learned collecting PS3 games over the years, what pitfalls to avoid, how to cope with the unpredictable hurdles collecting will put in front of you. 
PART 1:
Today I talk more general advice: Which YouTube channels have I found helpful in my journey as a collector? The channel names are listed in the Time Stamps section.

TIME STAMPS
===============
00:00 Intro - the PS3 Launch - requests for recommendations
03:40 Advice: Do Make Your Own Mistakes!
05:50 Theory & Practice
07:00 Helpful: YouTube videos actually are
08:35 Pete Dorr channel
12:12 SuperDerek RPGs channel
13:30 Metal Jesus Rocks channel
14:40 Mystic channel
16:20 Look Back in Anger: Game Collecting in 2022 ...
17:15 There must be women collectors ...? ðŸ¤”
17:30 Kelsey Lewin channel and collab on other channels
18:20 Daria Plays channel and Twitter
19:05 Facebook Marketplace and Reddit
20:30 Yunalescka channel and Twitter
21:25 Femtrooper and Cannot Be Tamed channels
22:00 Happy Console Gamer (Johnny Millennium) channel
===============

Link-a-Link!
---------------------
https://www.reddit.com/r/gamecollecting/
also: https://www.reddit.com/r/PS3/ to see what PS3 games others are collecting!

"Collecting video games is a labor of love." - A good general guide by the electronics business RecordHead.
https://recordhead.biz/guide-collecting-video-games/

Another channel that may be helpful if you're heavily into JRPGs (both modern and classic) is Erick Landon:  https://youtu.be/iJtv3iLQZmw
-------------------------------

Collecting video games is a hobby for grown-ups (you need funds, a budget). My video is therefore NOT suitable for children as per the COPPA legislation.

#gamecollecting #PS3 #collectingtips #collectingadvice
